page.title: 09Keadby Power Station
page.content: It is situated 0.8km west of Keadby with its own pumphouse on Trentside, Keadby.The surrounding countryside is flat and the main station building with its three chimneys has formed a definite landmark for the area but it is due to be demolished within the next year or two.The station was completed in 1952.The land used was good arable land.It occupied a site area of 73.2 hectares divided into two areas by the public road known as Chapel Lane,Keadby.The Eastern section contained the main buildings housing the boilers and turbines,together with the offices,workshops and stores.The Western section contained the rail sidings,the coal storage area and land for the deposition of ash from the boilers.Access by road is from three directions-from Trentside in Keadby. -Power Station Road from Crowle.
